inclusion.criterion: therapy/peripheral blood stem cell (PBSC) or bone marrow (BM) rescue for any stage of multiple myeloma
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Platelet count (transfusion independent) > 50,000 cells/mm^3 for 5 calendar days after recovery from high dose
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Absolute granulocyte count > 1500 cells/mm^3 for 5 calendar days after recovery from high dose
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Patients will start therapy between 30 days to 120 days after transplant
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Willingness and ability to comply with Food and Drug Administration (FDA)-mandated S.T.E.P.S. (Celgene System for Thalidomide Education and Prescribing Safety) Program
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Signing a written informed consent form
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: A left ventricular ejection fraction less than 45%; patients with congestive heart disease, history of myocardial infarction (MI), or coronary artery disease
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Total bilirubin greater than 2 mg/ml (unless history of Gilbert's disease)
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Serum glutamic oxaloacetic transaminase (SGOT) or serum glutamic pyruvic transaminase (SGPT) > 2.5 x upper limit of normal
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: History of deep venous thrombus, arterial occlusions, or pulmonary emboli
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Patients who cannot give informed consent
exclusion.label: not_met

notes: Patient has multiple myeloma, s/p allogeneic transplant with recurrent disease and with systemic amyloidosis. She was treated with melphalan and prednisone, followed by VAD regimen, and autologous stem cell transplant.
